answers.q: why disodium tartrate dihydrate is used for kf
answers.a: Because it is a stable, well-defined hydrate (Na2C4H4O6Â·2H2O) with a precise water content of about 15.66% w/w, it can be weighed accurately and releases its water quantitatively, making it an ideal primary standard for Karl Fischer titration.

answers.q: why disodium tartrate used in karl fischer
answers.a: It provides a known, constant amount of water to calibrate or verify KF titrators, dissolves cleanly without side reactions, and is easy to handle and store compared with other potential water standards.
